title: Daily Market-Mover Brief

top5.headline: Iran conducts Hormuz exercises ahead of US–Iran nuclear talks
top5.mechanism: Visible military signaling in a key oil chokepoint can lift crude risk premium even without a physical disruption, feeding inflation expectations and rates pricing.

market_impact.description: Hormuz signaling → oil risk premium → inflation/rates expectations

top5.watch_next: Talk outcomes vs kinetic escalation risk (24–72h).

sources.outlet: Iran state media (as cited in analyst brief)
sources.summary: Iran holds military exercises in Strait of Hormuz.

top5.headline: Japan Q4 GDP misses expectations, complicating BoJ normalization
top5.mechanism: A weak growth print can push out tightening/normalization expectations, moving JGB yields and the yen via rate differentials and risk sentiment.

market_impact.description: Japan growth miss → BoJ path repricing → JGB/JPY moves

sources.summary: Japan Q4 GDP +0.2% annualized vs 1.6% expected (as noted in brief).

top5.headline: European tech/AI jitters weigh on DAX leadership
top5.mechanism: AI profit doubts can trigger sector rotation and spill into broader equity risk appetite, particularly in crowded positioning.

market_impact.description: AI skepticism → sector rotation → broader risk sentiment

top5.watch_next: Spillover to US tech futures and broader Europe follow-through (24–72h).

sources.summary: DAX ~-0.5%; Siemens ~-6% on AI profit doubts; rotation risk flagged.

top5.headline: US yields and soft CPI keep 'deeper cuts' narrative in play
top5.mechanism: Lower yields can ease financial conditions and lean USD tone; Fed communications can quickly reprice the front end if officials push back.

market_impact.description: Soft inflation/yields ↓ → easier conditions → USD sensitivity to Fed comms

sources.summary: Soft CPI cited at 2.4%; 10Y cited at 4.07% (Friday close); US cash markets closed Monday.

top5.headline: China Lunar New Year closure reduces onshore visibility, distorting liquidity signals
top5.mechanism: Onshore closure shifts price discovery offshore; thin liquidity can exaggerate CNH and regional moves, with risk of gap/volatility on reopen.

market_impact.description: Onshore closure → offshore-led pricing → reopen volatility risk

top5.watch_next: CNH behavior during closure; reopen volatility next week (24–72h).

sources.outlet: Exchange holiday schedule (as cited in brief)
sources.summary: Onshore markets closed for Lunar New Year; liquidity thin; offshore flows muted.

markets_snapshot.rates: US cash closed Monday; brief cites 10Y at 4.07% Friday and deeper-cuts pricing after soft CPI.
markets_snapshot.fx: JPY sensitive to BoJ repricing after GDP miss; CNH signals may be liquidity-distorted during China holiday.
markets_snapshot.equities: Europe mixed; DAX lagged on industrial/tech weakness and AI profit doubts.
markets_snapshot.credit: Lower yields typically ease conditions, but comms shocks can widen spreads in risk-off moves.
markets_snapshot.energy: Brent described holding near $68.70 with a geopolitics tension floor from Hormuz signaling.

geopolitics_watch.chokepoints: Hormuz: military exercises signaling risk premium; Red Sea: diversions persist (per brief).
geopolitics_watch.sanctions: Geneva nuclear talks could influence sanctions relief/snapback discussions; market channel via oil supply waivers (per brief).
geopolitics_watch.escalation_risk: Key 24–72h driver is talk outcomes vs kinetic escalation in theater.

next_catalysts: US–Iran nuclear talks (Geneva): headlines on sanctions/supply stance
Fed speakers (Tue/Wed): communications risk to front end
FOMC minutes: tone vs 'deeper cuts' pricing
BoJ commentary: reaction function after GDP miss
China holiday liquidity: watch CNH and prepare for reopen volatility next week

methodology.evidence_standards: Confirmed = primary/official sources; Reported = secondary coverage or market color; unverified claims are explicitly flagged.
methodology.continuity_tracking: Each Top-5 item declares New/Ongoing/Reversal versus prior brief and includes a reference date.
methodology.promotion_rule: Geopolitics is promoted to Top-5 only when it can reprice markets via energy, shipping/chokepoints, sanctions/export controls, or escalation risk.
